results.definition: the mental attitude that something is believable and should be accepted as true
examples: acceptance of Newtonian mechanics was unquestioned for 200 years

results.definition: a disposition to tolerate or accept people or situations
banking: a time draft drawn on and accepted by a bank
the act of accepting with approval; favorable reception
(contract law) words signifying consent to the terms of an offer (thereby creating a contract)
the act of taking something that is offered
examples: her acceptance of the gift encouraged him
he anticipated their acceptance of his offer

results.definition: the state of being acceptable and accepted
examples: torn jeans received no acceptance at the country club
